channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A mountain trek into winter's first wild beauty
item.description: Winter hits early and hard in the high country of New York's Adirondack Mountains. It also brings wild, spectral beauty.
item.content:encoded: Winter hits early and hard in the high country of New York's Adirondack Mountains. It also brings wild, spectral beauty.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Sen. Mark Kelly: Trump and Hegseth don't 'understand the Constitution'
item.description: Sen. Mark Kelly, D-Ariz., and other congressional Democrats released a video last week letting service members know they can refuse illegal orders. Kelly is now being investigated for misconduct.
item.content:encoded:
Sen. Mark Kelly, D-Ariz., and other congressional Democrats released a video last week letting service members know they can refuse illegal orders. Kelly is now being investigated for misconduct.

(Image credit: Zayrha Rodriguez)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: 'Illegal orders' and the investigation into Sen. Mark Kelly
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has threatened to have Sen. Mark Kelly court-martialed. We ask a former military lawyer if that's legal.
item.content:encoded: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has threatened to have Sen. Mark Kelly court-martialed. We ask a former military lawyer if that's legal.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: The U.S. plan for Ukraine-Russia peace is shifting. Here's where things stand
item.description: The Trump administration hails "progress" in peace talks for Ukraine after an initial proposal was changed to address European and Ukrainian objections.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration hails "progress" in peace talks for Ukraine after an initial proposal was changed to address European and Ukrainian objections.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Barred from Gaza for 2 years, international journalists are still fighting for access
item.description: Israel's Supreme Court has again pressed the government to explain why, more than two years into the war, it still bars independent journalists from entering Gaza.
item.content:encoded: Israel's Supreme Court has again pressed the government to explain why, more than two years into the war, it still bars independent journalists from entering Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Viola Fletcher, one of the last survivors of the Tulsa Race Massacre, dies at 111
item.description: Viola Fletcher died Monday at the age of 111. She was one of the last survivors of the 1921 Tulsa massacre.
item.content:encoded: Viola Fletcher died Monday at the age of 111. She was one of the last survivors of the 1921 Tulsa massacre.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Caldwell

item.title: Why is U.S. health insurance so expensive?
item.description: Sure, insurance companies are part of the reason your premium went up this year -- but so are hospitals and doctors.
item.content:encoded: Sure, insurance companies are part of the reason your premium went up this year -- but so are hospitals and doctors.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Texas governor declares U.S. Muslim civil rights group a foreign terrorist organization
item.description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott invoked a relatively new Texas law to designate two groups as foreign terrorist organizations -- one being a national civil rights organization that serves the Muslim community.
item.content:encoded: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott invoked a relatively new Texas law to designate two groups as foreign terrorist organizations -- one being a national civil rights organization that serves the Muslim community.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Schneider

item.title: Rep. Greene's constituents say they are surprised by her decision to resign
item.description: NPR traveled to Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's Georgia district to hear what her constituents thought about their congresswoman's decision to resign next year after a falling out with President Trump.
item.content:encoded: NPR traveled to Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's Georgia district to hear what her constituents thought about their congresswoman's decision to resign next year after a falling out with President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Kallis

item.title: How studying lions' roars with AI can help with conservation efforts
item.description: Scientists have harnessed artificial intelligence to classify lion roars, a tool they say could help with lion conservation.
item.content:encoded: Scientists have harnessed artificial intelligence to classify lion roars, a tool they say could help with lion conservation.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow
